text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
HIVConfiguration 0..*BaseHIV.Configuration Logical Model
Instances of this logical model are not marked to be the target of a Reference
populationPrevalenceOfTb 1..1stringPopulation prevalence of TB
populationPrevalenceOfSoilTransmittedHelminthInfection 1..1stringPopulation prevalence of soil-transmitted helminth infection
populationIncidenceOfHivInTheAbsenceOfPrep 1..1stringPopulation incidence of HIV in the absence of PrEP
populationPrevalenceOfHiv 1..1stringPopulation prevalence of HIV
prevalenceOfPretreatmentNnrtiDrugResistance 1..1stringPrevalence of pretreatment NNRTI drug resistance
malariaEndemicSetting 1..1stringMalaria-endemic setting
populationPrevalenceOfSyphilis 1..1stringPopulation prevalence of syphilis
populationPrevalenceOfHepatitisB 1..1stringPopulation prevalence of hepatitis B
populationPrevalenceOfHepatitisC 1..1stringPopulation prevalence of hepatitis C
prevalenceOfHivInTheCatchmentArea 1..1stringPrevalence of HIV in the catchment area
ultrasoundAvailableAtTheHealthFacility 1..1stringUltrasound available at the health facility
hivBurdenOfTheSetting 1..1stringHIV burden of the setting
highHivBurdenSetting 1..1stringHigh HIV burden setting
lowHivBurdenSetting 1..1stringLow HIV burden setting
hpvDnaTestingOperationalAtTheHealthFacility 1..1stringHPV DNA testing operational at the health facility
routineViralLoadTestingIsAvailable 1..1stringRoutine viral load testing is available
healthFacilityId 1..1stringHealth facility ID
tbTreatingFacilityId 1..1stringTB treating facility ID
otherPriorityPopulations 1..1stringOther priority populations
reportingPeriodEndDate 1..1stringReporting period end date
reportingPeriodStartDate 1..1stringReporting period start date
reportingDate 1..1stringReporting date

Documentation for this format

name: HIVConfiguration
title: HIV.Configuration Logical Model
description: Logical Model for HIV.Configuration data elements.

element.definition: Logical Model for HIV.Configuration data elements.
The tuberculosis prevalence in the general population in number of cases per 100 000 persons or greater.

element.short: Population prevalence of soil-transmitted helminth infection
element.definition: The percentage of individuals in the general population infected with at least one species of soil-transmitted helminths

element.short: Population incidence of HIV in the absence of PrEP
element.definition: HIV incidence number of cases per 100 person–years in the absence of PrEP
The proportion of the population that are HIV-positive

element.short: Prevalence of pretreatment NNRTI drug resistance
element.definition: Prevalence of pretreatment HIV drug resistance to NNRTIs among people initiating first-line ART
Whether the setting is a malaria-endemic setting
The proportion of the population with syphilis
The proportion of hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAg) seroprevalence in the general population
The proportion of hepatitis C virus (HCV) antibody seroprevalence in the general population

element.short: Prevalence of HIV in the catchment area
element.definition: The proportion of the population from the health facilitys catchment area that are HIV-positive (estimated)

element.short: Ultrasound available at the health facility
element.definition: Whether an ultrasound machine is available and functional in the facility and a trained health worker is available to use it

HIV burden of the setting (high or low) based on the national HIV prevalence or where the HIV prevalence and/or incidence in a geographical setting is higher than national prevalence and, therefore, needs priority in the HIV response
Settings with >5% national HIV prevalence and subpopulations and geographic settings where HIV prevalence and/or incidence is higher than nationally.

Settings with <5% HIV national prevalence but where certain populations (primarily key populations and their partners) and geographic settings may have higher HIV prevalence and/or incidence than nationally and, therefore, need priority in the HIV response

element.short: HPV DNA testing operational at the health facility
element.definition: Is HPV DNA testing operational at the health facility for cervical cancer screening?

element.short: Routine viral load testing is available
element.definition: Routine viral load testing is available in the facility

Unique ID of the health facility that recorded the client. This ID could represent a universal health facility ID, if used in the country. Alternatively this ID can also be generated by the national surveillance system and assigned to reporting facility.
The facility where the client is receiving tuberculosis (TB) treatment
Other populations of priority of HIV prevention and care in local context (provided during adaptation)
End date of the reporting period
Start date of the reporting period
Reporting date, for surveys performed on a specific date
